title: How to make constructive criticism? Are there any books written on it - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi Rahul, Making Constructive Criticisms come easy, when one has the best interest of the other person, is in mind. Some of the tips, to make constructive criticisms, can be as follows:- Give a clear picture of the positive outcome / output, in advance, to the person, if he / she implements the criticism.Choose Words carefully, so that you ‘don't Hurt, you Heal’.Keep your tone soft and not aggressive.And finally, do not force your opinion. Rather, give Time and Patience to the person, to take the call based on his / her Time, Comfort and Convenience.

You can start by telling them about their strengths, slowly move to the criticism part. Like if they aren't politie enough, you can write your work is very good. May be you should also try with practicing a few ways to improve your communication. We need to constantly improve ourselves, you would reach great by learning more about communicating in a better way with clients.
